original_title: Lottery winner of Rs. 75mn abducted and assaluted
original_body_lines: The winner of a prize of Rs. 75 million in a sweep draw has been abducted and manhandled by a group of individuals within closed doors of a house at Ratmalkaduwa in Gampola for several days demanding money, since July 27, until Gampola Division Crime Investigation Unit and the STF rushed to the scene and secured his release on Saturday (5).
During the raid the Police arrested four suspects in connection with the incident.
The victim, a resident of Akurana in Kandy, had been abducted by four suspects including the owner of a sawmill in the area by motorcar to Gampola, who had locked him up in a house and assaulted him.

He told police that the suspects severely assaulted him demanding the money he had won in the sweep draw. He said the money had been entrusted to another individual for safety but investigations revealed that he had left for Japan. The victim stated that an individual with whom he had business transactions and who visited the scene obtained a letter from him that he owed Rs.30 million. He stated that the suspects obtained letters that he owed them Rs. 09 million.
Police suspect the possibility of there being a dispute over business transactions between the victim and the main suspect.
However, the officers of the Gampola Crime Investigation Unit said the circumstances that had led to the incident were in question.
They are conducting further investigations on the instructions of Gampola SSP Pradeep Ratnayaka. (Suranga Rajanayaka)
